name: Perceived Stress Scale
description: A 10-item psychological instrument for measuring the perception of stress. Items ask about feelings and thoughts during the last month.
reference: Cohen, S., Kamarck, T., & Mermelstein, R. (1983). A global measure of perceived stress. Journal of Health and Social Behavior, 24, 385-396.
instructions: The questions in this scale ask you about your feelings and thoughts during the last month. In each case, please indicate how often you felt or thought a certain way.

questions.name: pss_1
questions.description: In the last month, how often have you been upset because of something that happened unexpectedly?

questions.name: pss_2
questions.description: In the last month, how often have you felt that you were unable to control the important things in your life?

questions.name: pss_3
questions.description: In the last month, how often have you felt nervous and stressed?

questions.name: pss_4
questions.description: In the last month, how often have you felt confident about your ability to handle your personal problems?

questions.name: pss_5
questions.description: In the last month, how often have you felt that things were going your way?

questions.name: pss_6
questions.description: In the last month, how often have you found that you could not cope with all the things that you had to do?

questions.name: pss_7
questions.description: In the last month, how often have you been able to control irritations in your life?

questions.name: pss_8
questions.description: In the last month, how often have you felt that you were on top of things?

questions.name: pss_9
questions.description: In the last month, how often have you been angered because of things that happened that were outside of your control?

questions.name: pss_10
questions.description: In the last month, how often have you felt difficulties were piling up so high that you could not overcome them?
